TN.content: a question about the day came of me, to me, w/out invitation, before the day, “she” watches over day, pre-phenomenological, trans-phenomenological: “quand nos yeux se touchent, fait-il jour ou fait-il nuit?”

TN.content: Derrida determined to show limitless patience ready for infinite, time of experience itself
TN.linkedContent: Derrida determined to show limitless patience ready for infinite, time of experience itself

TN.content: very little use of “you” and apostrophe in philosophy
TN.linkedContent: very little use of “you” and apostrophe in philosophy

TN.content: se toucher toi, “Je se touche”; “tu” [in philosophical discourse] signs general/plural singularity of possible addressee, also signs possibility/need for “I” to address itself as an other > oneself: first & last other
TN.linkedContent: se toucher toi, “Je se touche”; “tu” [in philosophical discourse] signs general/plural singularity of possible addressee, also signs possibility/need for “I” to address itself as an other > oneself: first & last other

TN.content: for Chrétian, Christ is one, common body, not a plurality of bodies > Chrétian & Nancy deal w/ a different “yes,” or a different provenance of same “yes,” addressed to “you”
TN.linkedContent: for Chrétian, Christ is one, common body, not a plurality of bodies > Chrétian & Nancy deal w/ a different “yes,” or a different provenance of same “yes,” addressed to “you”

TN.content: se toucher toi—unforgettable event, sans example, deprives us of all “for example,” an event from which one should re-partir, to prepare for another departure (autre départ)
TN.linkedContent: se toucher toi—unforgettable event, sans example, deprives us of all “for example,” an event from which one should re-partir, to prepare for another departure (autre départ)

TN.content: reflexivity of se toucher toi of 2 borders (bords) does not submit to logic of mirror, speculum
TN.linkedContent: reflexivity of se toucher toi of 2 borders (bords) does not submit to logic of mirror, speculum

TN.content: eyes touch btwn 2 orients: invisible eye (touchable), seeing eye (untouchable)
TN.linkedContent: eyes touch btwn 2 orients: invisible eye (touchable), seeing eye (untouchable)

TN.content: dissymmetry of se toucher toi makes “you” the touchable (untouchable) pole of an apostrophizing address
TN.linkedContent: dissymmetry of se toucher toi makes “you” the touchable (untouchable) pole of an apostrophizing address

TN.content: the heart of this other heart cannot be touched, does not touch itself, it self touches you; it is the heart insofar as m’appartient à toi ——for there to be a good heart: possibility of bad heart must remain forever open, i.e. tout autre > good heart must be ready for the other, for treachery, for perjury (inevitable-impossible vow of abstinence, tactile’s fate); is this how we can translate Kant’s “evil heart”?
TN.linkedContent: the heart of this other heart cannot be touched, does not touch itself, it self touches you; it is the heart insofar as m’appartient à toi ——for there to be a good heart: possibility of bad heart must remain forever open, i.e. tout autre > good heart must be ready for the other, for treachery, for perjury (inevitable-impossible vow of abstinence, tactile’s fate); is this how we can translate Kant’s “evil heart”?

TN.content: this other heart that self touches you, gives pleasure where pleasure’s made more intense by not returning to me, diastole w/out systole > the ecstatic & haptical sans of “sans revenir à soi”
TN.linkedContent: this other heart that self touches you, gives pleasure where pleasure’s made more intense by not returning to me, diastole w/out systole > the ecstatic & haptical sans of “sans revenir à soi”

TN.content: you beat the heart, you interrupt circulation
TN.linkedContent: you beat the heart, you interrupt circulation

TN.content: diastole w/out systole, interruption risks death at every moment, other heart se touche toi only to be exposed to death: toi es (t) aussi ma mort [at heart of a finite thinking]
TN.linkedContent: diastole w/out systole, interruption risks death at every moment, other heart se touche toi only to be exposed to death: toi es (t) aussi ma mort [at heart of a finite thinking]

TN.content: you, metronome of my heteronomy, you resist my dreams of a reappropriating movement of self-presence, self-consciousness, absolute knowledge, which is why I love you, so painfully, at heart of pleasure itself
TN.linkedContent: you, metronome of my heteronomy, you resist my dreams of a reappropriating movement of self-presence, self-consciousness, absolute knowledge, which is why I love you, so painfully, at heart of pleasure itself

TN.content: you break me from dialectic (which does not exclude it)
TN.linkedContent: you break me from dialectic (which does not exclude it)

TN.content: the “self” is as indispensable as you in se toucher toi, an “I” unable to touch itself couldn't se plier à ce qui le déplie absolument, au tout autre qui, comme tout autre, habite mon coeur en étranger > no anthropological limit here > “divine,” “animal,” & life all derivative of se toucher toi
TN.linkedContent: the “self” is as indispensable as you in se toucher toi, an “I” unable to touch itself couldn't se plier à ce qui le déplie absolument, au tout autre qui, comme tout autre, habite mon coeur en étranger > no anthropological limit here > “divine,” “animal,” & life all derivative of se toucher toi

TN.content: w/out l’épreuve of impossibility of auto-affection—no love
TN.linkedContent: w/out l’épreuve of impossibility of auto-affection—no love

TN.content: auto-hetero-affection inaugurates all experience: speech, declaration of love
TN.linkedContent: auto-hetero-affection inaugurates all experience: speech, declaration of love

TN.content: to touch as tact, thanks to you, because of you, is to break (rompre) w/ immediacy wrongly associated w/ touch (in ontology, self-presence, transcendental idealism, body proper, etc.)
TN.linkedContent: to touch as tact, thanks to you, because of you, is to break (rompre) w/ immediacy wrongly associated w/ touch (in ontology, self-presence, transcendental idealism, body proper, etc.)

TN.content: eyes meet, infinitely, mouths in contact [unsatisfied w/ insipid figures, however interesting/necessary], thought begins, jusqu’à l’abîme, plunging Narcissus into abyss: makes day or night possible > day and night themselves promising each other, au point du jour
